issues.title: Define a more generic [H2_|H3]_CAPSULE_ERROR
issues.author: DavidSchinazi
issues.body:
RFC 9297 defines H3_DATAGRAM_ERROR as "Datagram or Capsule Protocol parse error". Then it started being used to convey errors during the parsing of data inside capsules by [connect-ip](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9484#section-4.7.2-8):

> If any of the capsule fields are malformed upon reception, the receiver of the capsule MUST follow the error-handling procedure defined in [Section 3.3](https://rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9297#section-3.3) of [[HTTP-DGRAM](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9484#RFC9297)].

This has caused confusion for readers, both in [QUIC Proxying](https://github.com/ietf-wg-masque/draft-ietf-masque-quic-proxy/pull/118#discussion_r1786562062) and in [WRAP_UP](https://github.com/DavidSchinazi/draft-schinazi-httpbis-wrap-up/issues/3).

So we should define more generic capsule parsing errors for h2 and h3.
